title: People being boosted on stream
body:
dekar is boosting people on his stream using dynamic queue. They pay him money and he boosts them. Is it cheating? nope, because its dynamic queue and he is just 'playing with friends'.

Do i hate him for this? nope. Why? because he is showing everyone that dynamic queue sucks dick by doing this and being so open about it.

replies.body:
Well he is not boosting. He is like Riot would put it making new friends and playing with them.

/sarcasm off

Dynamic queue has so much design flaws built into it it's not even funny. This whole season feels like Riot using the playerbase as testers in preparation for season 7.

Before Dynamic Queue, playing with a friend was possible and considered as solo queue. Even then, this kind of behavior was possible and pinning this as a major flaw of Dynamic Queue is a pretty weak argument.
No matter how you put this, if he is getting payed to boost them and this transaction is on the stream for all to see, it is considered as boosting and Riot will deal with the issue at hand. In this case, it is not "playing with friends".

>he is showing everyone that dynamic queue sucks dick by doing this and being so open about it

So essentially, if there was a loophole where i could kill someone and never get convicted for it and i actually do it, i'd be hailed as a hero for pointing this out for everyone to see and start doing it?

What a hero, indeed.
This action will get him and his buddies banned on the spot.
Don't be one of those people who are willing to make bounds and leaps in order to get something they don't like, removed.

How is he going to be banned? He's not breaking any of the UA (user agreement). They are paying to play with him. Don't people who give donations to QT/Trick2G/ect. also get this? Some even in ranked. Until Riot changes their UA to include this exact thing, it's kosher to do.

You misunderstood OP's and mine comment.
OP worded his like this guy was open about boosting people on stream for money and i merely said that if this was the case, he's going to get banned along with anyone who was boosted.

And if these were just subscriber donations or donations to get him to play rank with them, that's a completely different story.

Would you care to explain where you're getting the information that they would get banned? You aren't talking about mmr boosting that riot normally talks about right? Because that has to do with someone else playing on your own account in ranked (whether you win or lose), it has nothing to do with playing in a premade.
Boosting is a direct violation of the League code of conduct

Correct, but playing with someone (old duoQ) was not counted as boosting. Just as the new DynamticQ is not counted as boosting. In order for Riot to punish someone for "boosting", the person being punished must not be playing their own account. 

So let's say you and I are playing together. Even if you pay me money, if you use your account and I use mine (duo/dynamicQ) it is not "boosting". Boosting is sharing accounts. If you payed Faker 10k to play 20 ranked games with you, that's fine. You can not get into trouble for that. You would if Faker used YOUR account to solo climb. But as long as you are each playing your own account everything is legit.
No, boosting by carrying a player into the next rank is still boosting and is still against the League CoC

Nope, you play under the rules of Riot.
He claims he is boosting someone, Riot does not.
If Riot would punish him for it, they would have to admit there is something wrong with their own system. Basically they would have to remove ranked dynamic queue.

The definition of boosting can be expanded upon, if there's a specific system in place that allows you to boost players in other ways.

And no, i'm not saying that him getting payed by donors to play in their premades is considered as boosting. I merely made a comment to what OP posted, i did not watch the stream in question. I think OP knew this wasn't boosting but left it as it is to attract attention and i fell for it.

Well played, OP.
Well played.

Remind me what it's called when someone causes you to jump ranks far faster than you ever could on your own?

I can't quite remember the term. Boot string? Bee sting? Boo King?

Oh wait no! Helping a total stranger out for monetary gain! That's right :)  Totes not boosting.

What the guy is doing on stream is definitely boosting, it just isn't the same kind of boosting that riot has defined. It isn't the kind of boosting that gets you banned. But pretty much playing with someone to get into a rank you don't belong in is considered boosting, it just isn't bannable.
I hate people who boost. Because then I get stuck with these *diamond/plat* players that go 1/13,  never ward and just complain the entire game.
See this shit right here is why boasting about your rank means jack diddly.

If you're {{champion:238}}  with a score of 0/6 fighting a {{champion:25}} before the 10 min mark, you don't blame your jungler or call your team a bunch of idiots.  You instead try to help them in any way possible, seeing as you can't deal damage or tank that leaves one option, to give your team vision and farm until you are strong enough to help. 

No one likes dynamic queue because it allows players who don't have the skill to rise up way past their due rating. So instead of focusing on warding, how about you focus on the big picture?

you sound salty bro.  trust me, i rather pay for someone to boost me than to play with some kid who is going to afk or intentionally feed because he's on tilt from last game and me lose on purpose.

dynamic q is the best thing riot has done.  at least you don't get to play with 3 other retards.  you can invite your friends are just be 5 retards lol jk. but you get my point.  i used to hate duo q and the enemy would pick on the retarded guy on my team that never listen to any advice and would you kept dying 1v3 every single time.

as for name shaming, downvote.  i don't see how your post is not deleted.  but oh my, if it was a random person saying xxfioramasterxx17 fed last game, his account would be perma ban and his post deleted.
Please tell me this is a joke...

I mean, to be fair, he's not COMPLETELY wrong.

Dynamic queue is not the best thing that has ever come to league, but even as a 1 man squad, there will be generally less toxicity and raging because people are playing with their friends.

Guy 1 isn't gonna AFK because he's queued with Guy 2 and Grill Gamer 1 ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

Obviously Dynamic queue has a lot of problems, but it's not completely terrible.

Have you ever been a solo in a toxic 3-4 man premade? They basically bully you all game, tell the other team to report you, they all report you, they tell the other team you're saying things you aren't but it looks believable in numbers. Then you get 3-4 man reported + whatever enemies believe them, while they get 1-2 reports. 

Premades is by far the worst thing to happen to ranked LoL.
This is partly why I mute my team 95% of the time.  I turned off /all a longtime ago and am much happier because of that decision.

So the way i understand this is, since he is a streamer, these people are "donating" to him and he is "out of the goodness of his heart" playing with them in ranked to "help" give them a better ranked experience.

Problem is that this is a way around the whole boosting thing. Boosting is when you, as the higher player, get someone elses account and play on their account (regardless of being payed) until that players account is a higher elo than it should be and then give the account back to the actual owner.

So what people like him are doing is working around that.
The funny part is I said this would happen, and everyone said I was full of it =).
Boosting companies capable of boosting 5 accounts at the same time. Think of the money they making. 5 D1+ players showering in money playing on low elo accounts. GG RIOT.

Even in solo que boosting existed . All the booster have to do is have a smurf and the person he's boosting. Solo que or dynamic que the issue of boosting still exist. My solution to this phenomenon is removing the ability to que with another person when it comes down to ranks. If an individual wants to play with their friends then go play blink pink. Rank is for people to test their own individual skill level and improving their mechanics. Dynamic is removing the aspect of individual play and stating a statement " I don't even have to be good at this game to reach diamond" .

If it's involved money, it's boosting and they will be banned.

It has nothing to do with dynamic queue. The same person could have done it under the old queue.
Yea and I used to play with my friends on my smurf. IN OLD SOLO QUEUE. nothings changed

The great, vast majority of people aren't boosting though. So what's your issue? It's the same logic the anti-gun crowd tries to tout. 

Can't punish everyone for the sake of the few.

More ppl than you think are getting in elos they don't deserve by just playing with friends.

Thats not intended boosting but they end up in a higher elo than they deserve anyway

If I had a dollar for every lane opponent that couldn't CS and fed me but got carried by his premade and ended the game 1/8.....

Well then I would have purchased this legal boost to Gold V and stopped playing ranked.
**Who give a damn.... this boosted player will fall down to bronze once he will play alone.**

And drag down the solo players on his team during his plummet.

But then again I guess that's something only people who don't play premade have to deal with

thats actually a legit way to boost people , it doesnt break any rulles 
imagine my main account is like diamon 3 , and i play with friend or viewers  on a smurf with their silver mmr ,  you understand the diam 3 will 1v9 and carry his premades . you can make them pay money if they want to get boosted or " carried for 20 games in a row " .
in the end it is the same as elo boosting, people pay you to get free elo .
but it doesnt break any rules because Dynamic q allows that .
The fact that this is 100% legal shows the problem with DQ

Dynamic Q is absolute garbage for anyone that doesnt have a group. PERIOD.


Never before have i been ganked IN THE JUNGLE AS A JUNGLER. But with the help of 3-5 man squads in ranked....every single time i get spotted in river every person they have sprints over to scuttle and its a 3-4 man gank in the jungle.

And of course, my team isnt grouped and hasnt been playing together for months so when their lane goes mia for 3 seconds they just ping...no one is comming to help me. 

Im not whining about there being amazing team play on the enemy team...im whining about playing alone against a group of people on Curse Voice coordinating strikes like seal team six Vs my team of complete strangers playing a literally different game "Solo Q".


MMR is no longer a sufficient stat to balance a match on. Teamwork and coordination have to be measured somehow. you cant be allowed to play alone vs a group of people that have been playing together for months or seasons even.

Junglers have it the hardest with this DQ shit, made me quit my main role. Can't get a leash without getting 4 man invaded, no turrets or minions to hide behind, Riot removed green wards so you can't ward your own jungle by yourself. Forget even trying to solo dragon, I hardly make the call anymore because it's always 5 enemies showing up before I even get it to half HP.

Seeing as Riot would rather attack the symptoms than the root of the problem (we all know DQ is here to stay) I propose jg camps automatically attack and do double damage to champs without smite so premades think twice before walking around in the enemy jungle

The question is if the system allow people to play on equal ground. If people play on equal ground, that the result does not even matter. if people can't play on equal ground, the system MUST be changed
The problem is that you talk about game results rather than the equity of the system, which, again is the core question

the actual problem is the original post....high ranked players on smurf accounts getting with their other high ranked buddies on their smurfs smashing people trying to learn the game.

In the original post the guy assumed that it was because of DQ, and nope, even on old queue you could do the same by going duo queue - and in the original post the guy made also accusation that is not really proving as someone else was posting the streamer account match history and pointed out like the guy was playing max 2-3 game with the same people, which can be barely considered boosting since the max you can get from 3 game is win a promotion series to go 1 division up? -

And I actually doubt that if multiple high ranked player play together they are not going to rank up so fast that the problem becomes negligible in the way you are painting it...

The real problem are the guys paying other guy to play with them to really get boosted (and it takes more than 3 games, really), which are fairly difficult to catch because it requires a lot of time to do the proper investigation to ban them and it seems clear that Riot doesn't have or isn't putting enough resources in to catch most of them
